headline: Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce
description: These seared pork chops are topped with a rich and creamy mushroom sauce that gets flavored with fresh herbs.
name: Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce

nutrition.servingSize: 4 servings, 1 pork chop & about 1/3 cup sauce each

recipeIngredient: 4 bone-in pork chops, 1/2-3/4 inch thick (about 2 pounds), trimmed
8 ounces sliced mixed mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake & oyster
0.5 cup chopped fresh herbs, such as chives, tarragon and/or parsley

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle pork chops with 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet, preferably cast iron, over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium and add 2 pork chops. Cook, turning once, until cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove to a plate and tent with foil. Repeat with another 1 tablespoon oil and the remaining chops.

Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the pan. Add shallots and mushrooms; cook, stirring frequently until the mushrooms are browned, 2 to 4 minutes. Add wine and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt; cook, stirring up any browned bits, until the liquid is mostly evaporated, 1 to 3 minutes. Stir in half-and-half and herbs; cook until bubbling, about 1 minute more. Serve the chops with the mushroom sauce.

review.reviewBody: This recipe was easy, but I didn't really care for it. There was a lot more sauce than the picture shows, so I had to thicken it up with corn starch and serve over mashed potatoes. It wasn't very appealing because the sauce was brown from the mushrooms. Cooking the pork for that amount of time was perfect though.

Delicious, easy and fast weeknight recipe! Made exactly as instructed. For herbs, I threw in 2 sprigs of rosemary I had on hand. The amount of sauce was sufficient for me, as I'm trying to 'eat well', but my kids (who are picky about mushrooms) and my husband wanted more. Next time I will double the recipe for the sauce. Will definitely make it again!

Delicious recipe! I agree regarding the amount of sauce that was produced...it would have been slightly better with more. Added Garlic and Basil to ingredients with a little extra half & Half-(yummy Half and half) 
 and left out Tarragon (didn't have any).

Loved this recipe! The only changes I made, were adding a tablespoon of butter just prior to cooking the mushrooms and shallots, a sprinkle of flour, and a splash of chicken stock. I used chives and parsley for the herbs. The gravy was excellent, but next time I may just stop after cooking the mushrooms and shallots and sprinkle a few herbs on top.
I added garlic when cooking the mushrooms and shallots. So good!

Fast, easy and no fuss
This turned out so flavorful despite the little effort and few ingredients needed. My husband loves his sauces though so there wasn't enough for him. I'll double the sauce for him next time.
The herbs i used were parsley, sage, cilantro and watercress. I could have used more easily, but I love my greens!
Pros: fewer dishes, fast, easy

Delicious 
Looked just like picture and taste just as good. I would recommend to friends and family.
Pros: Quick and easy
Cons: None at all

so yummy!
My husband is not a big mushroom fan but he said he liked this...a lot! Great taste! Pork chops were very tender. Leftovers were just as tasty!

Pros: My husband and I both enjoyed this dish! We will definitely create it again.
